What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Serious grammar involvement with Kiswahili... Learning how to speak grammatically correct Kiswahili is pretty fascinating.
More Swahili grammar, more vocab, better speaking skills
I LOVED THIS CLASS SO MUCH! BEST CHOICE I MADE AT YALE
Much of the culture and history of east Africa, as well as Kiswahili!
A basic knowledge of the language, as well as very interesting insight into east african culture.
Foundation of Kiswahili grammar, vocabulary, culture and some history

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: A lot of personal attention to students because the class is small and there is a min of a professor and a TA who are native speakers. The professor also holds 2 Kiswahili tables(lunches with him and a TA, where one tries to speak only in Kiswahili and the teachers help them--a great way to let yourself speak and advance immensely into the language). Weaknesses: No use of videos or video materials. No use of listening materials. This cause you to get behind on getting used to speech of native speakers of the language. Sometimes the class also uses a lot of English instead of Kiswahili. Improvements: Use video and listening materials. Try to reinforce using Kiswahili as much as possible. Increase the level of difficulty in homework
The class is very logically structured. It teaches useful Swahili vocab and grammar.
Wonderfully taught and very fair workload. Kiarie does a great job meeting students where they are.
This course was great. It was very engaging and I feel that I gained a lot from the course, beyond just basic ability to speak a language.

This course is really accessible and the class becomes a community very quickly. There is a lot of content covered in a short period of time but regular assessments ensure that we stay on top of this.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Great class to advance in Kiswahili grammar. Kiswahili grammar is pretty complex but very logical. TRY TO SPEAK ONLY IN KISWAHILI and try to make others do it too. That's the best way you can put the grammar into use. And if you don't the class can easily become people speaking in English about Kiswahili.
I would definitely recommend Swahili L2. Mwalimu is wonderful, and the class is really useful. It is slightly more challenging that L1, but it is definitely okay.
Yes! It's so much more personal than any other language department, and kiarie is literally one of the best teachers I've ever had.
If you want to learn Kiswahili, this is a great class through which to build your foundation!
